optimization_record.recommendation_description: This advisor provides step-by-step instructions for creating a <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> design. Some steps apply only to the <TOKEN_STRATIX> revision and others apply only to the <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> revision. You must be in the appropriate revision to perform these steps.
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: NA

optimization_record.recommendation_description: You can use the Support section of the Altera web site or Quartus II Help to obtain more information on the <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> flow as outlined in the HardCopy Advisor.
optimization_record.description: You can find the steps outlined in the HardCopy Advisor in the HardCopy chapter of the Quartus II Handbook. You can also get help on the specific settings and assignments described in the HardCopy Advisor by using Quartus II Help.

action.action_description: For more information, use the HardCopy chapter of the Quartus II Handbook or Quartus II Help.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> Naming Guidelines
optimization_record.description: Please use the following guidelines when naming design entries, for example, names of pins, buses, ports, and nodes, that you create for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> designs: 1. Start all your names with a lower case letter (a-z). 2. Use only lower case letters, numbers and underscores (a-z, 0-9, _).

action.action_description: Follow the guidelines when naming <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> design entries.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Altera requires that you use the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer for migrating designs targeting <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> devices.
optimization_record.description: The TimeQuest Timing Analyzer's increased power and flexibility enables you to constrain more complex designs, especially those with complex clock schemes including clock muxing or source synchronous clock schemes. TimeQuest uses the same timing paradigm and Synopsys Design Constraint syntax as Synopsys PrimeTime, allowing a smooth migration to final layout in the Altera HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on Use TimeQuest Timing Analyzer during compilation in the Timing Analysis Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Choose a <TOKEN_STRATIX> or a <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> device
optimization_record.description: You must first create a design for a <TOKEN_STRATIX> or a <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> device.

action.action_description: Choose a <TOKEN_STRATIX> or a <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> device in the Device page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

acf_variable_list.acf_variable: Stratix II|HardCopy II|Stratix III|HardCopy III|Stratix IV| HardCopy IV

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Choose a <TOKEN_TEXT1> device
optimization_record.description: You must first create a design for a <TOKEN_TEXT1> device before migrating to a <TOKEN_TEXT2> device. Once you have successfully compiled for the <TOKEN_TEXT1> device you can migrate to a <TOKEN_TEXT2> device.

action.action_description: Choose a <TOKEN_TEXT1> device in the Device page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu). You must choose a <TOKEN_TEXT1> device which has a <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion device.

acf_variable_list.acf_variable: Stratix II|HardCopy II|Stratix III|HardCopy III|Stratix IV| HardCopy IV

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Choose a <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion device
optimization_record.description: You must choose a <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion device for migration. You must choose a specific <TOKEN_TEXT1> device if you did not do so in the previous step. Auto device is not supported for migration. Once you have successfully compiled for the <TOKEN_TEXT1> device you can migrate to a <TOKEN_TEXT2> device.

action.action_description: Choose a <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion device at the bottom-right corner of the Device page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu). You must choose a specific <TOKEN_TEXT1> device if you did not do so in the previous step.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: The following are required for creating a successful <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> conversion.
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: NA

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Turn on the Design Assistant
optimization_record.description: Altera requires all HardCopy Series designs to be checked for design rule violations using the Quartus II Design Assistant. Altera recommends turning on the Design Assistant to run automatically during each compile, so that during your development, you can see violations that must be fixed. Design Assistant is required to be run for all HardCopy designs and all Critical and High level errors must be fixed before submitting your design to the Altera HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on the Design Assistant in the Design Assistant page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Because the <TOKEN_STRATIX> device has different timing characteristics from the <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> device, you must follow certain recommendations in setting up timing constraints
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: NA

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable Register Recovery Removal in the Timing Analyzer
optimization_record.description: This setting allows the Quartus II Timing Analysis tool to calculate Recovery and Removal times on control and reset signals. Recovery is the minimum length of time that an asynchronous control input pin must be stable before the clock active edge. Removal is the minimum length of time that an asynchronous control input pin must be stable after the clock active edge. Altera recommends turning this setting "On" during development, as it gives a more complete timing analysis of all logic paths in your design. However, if your design has no timing requirement for reset logic, this analysis can be turned "Off."

action.action_description: Turn on Enable Recovery/Removal analysis in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Run the timing constraint check as part of Timing Analysis
optimization_record.description: This setting enables the Timing Analysis tool to perform a review of your timing constraints for completeness and Min/Max timing coverage for all inputs, outputs, and bidirectional pins, as well as clock settings for all clock sources. Asynchronous pins such as resets and static control signals are also checked for Min/Max delay constraints. This is required to be turned "On" for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and reviewed before handoff of the design to the HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on Enable Timing Constraint Check in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Have the Timing Analyzer report worst case and best case timing in one combined report
optimization_record.description: The Quartus II software allows for separate timing analysis to be performed at worst case and best case conditions as independent reports. The "Report Combined Fast/Slow Timing" setting allows the Quartus II software to report worst case and best case timing in one combined report. Turning this setting "On" will give a more complete timing report for your design by allowing you to see all hold time issues as well as setup issues in one report, and is required for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development.

action.action_description: Turn on Report Combined Fast/Slow Timing in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Have the Timing Analyzer report I/O Paths separately
optimization_record.description: This setting creates separate report panels for IO paths constrained by INPUT_MAX_DELAY, INPUT_MIN_DELAY, OUTPUT_MAX_DELAY or OUTPUT_MIN_DELAY. You can specify these constraints using Assignment Editor. By default, IO paths are reported in Clock Setup and Clock Hold panels. This setting is required to be turned "On" so that detailed IO timing analysis can be performed for each pin of your device. This is optional in FPGA designs, but is critical for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development, since the IO timing requirements you specify must be met in both <TOKEN_STRATIX> IO timing and <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> IO timing results. This helps to guarantee drop-in compatibility between your <TOKEN_STRATIX> FPGA prototype and your <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> structured ASIC.

action.action_description: Turn on Report I/O Paths Separately in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Turning on Clock Latency improves the modeling of complex clocking relationships (for example, relationships between PLL clocks or between derived and base clocks).
optimization_record.description: Better modeling of complex clocking relationships is essential for an accurate timing report and appropriate design optimization to meet timing constraints. Clock Latency affects the timing relationships computed between registers clocked by related clocks by affecting both the SETUP and HOLD relationships between registers and the clock skews to those registers. Clock Latency also enables better modeling of clock relationships that can help fitter optimization for both fast and slow timing corners. Once Clock Latency is enable, any multi-clock transfer that has a Multi-cycle assignment may need to be changed to account for the difference in Setup/Hold Relationship.

action.action_description: Turn on Enable Clock Latency in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Certain assignments and features are not available for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: NA

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Physical Synthesis Optimizations are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: Physical Synthesis Optimizations are not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be turned off.

action.action_description: Turn off Physical Synthesis Optimizations in the Physical Synthesis Optimizations page of the Settings dialog (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Virtual Pins are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: Virtual Pins are not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be removed.

action.action_description: Remove any virtual pins in the Assignment Editor.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Specifying Max Fanouts is not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: Specifying Max Fanouts is not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and all max fanout assignments must be removed.

action.action_description: Remove any max fanout assignments in the Assignment Editor. If you have them in the source files, remove them as well.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Compile <TOKEN_TEXT1> revision
optimization_record.description: Compile the design and verify it fits in the selected <TOKEN_TEXT1> device.

action.action_description: Press the button below to start compilation.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Check <TOKEN_TEXT1> revision
optimization_record.description: Verify the specified companion <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> device is compatible with the design, Design Assistant passes with no errors, the timing requirements were successfully met and all paths were timing constrained, and I/O types are fully defined for all the I/O pins.

action.action_description: Press the button below to verify the compilation was successful for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Create a <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion revision
optimization_record.description: For a project to be considered for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> conversion it must have both a <TOKEN_STRATIX> and <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> revision. These revisions are linked together and are called "Companion Revisions". If you make changes to your source revision, you must overwrite the changes from that revision to your companion revision.

action.action_description: Run the Create/Overwrite <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> Companion Revision command (Project menu). After that you will need to open the companion revision to continue.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: The following are required for creating a successful <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> conversion.
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: NA

optimization_record.description: Altera requires all HardCopy Series designs to be checked for design rule violations using the Quartus II Design Assistant. Altera recommends turning on the Design Assistant to run automatically during each compile, so that during your development, you can see violations that must be fixed. Design Assistant is required to be run for all HardCopy designs and all Critical and High level errors must be fixed before submitting your design to the Altera HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on the Design Assistant in the Design Assistant page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

Clock Latency also enables better modeling of clock relationships that can help fitter optimization for both fast and slow timing corners. Once Clock Latency is enable, any multi-clock transfer that has a Multi-cycle assignment may need to be changed to account for the difference in Setup/Hold Relationship.

optimization_record.description: NA

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Physical Synthesis Optimizations are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: Physical Synthesis Optimizations are not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be turned off.

action.action_description: Turn off Physical Synthesis Optimizations in the Physical Synthesis Optimizations page of the Settings dialog (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Virtual Pins are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: Virtual Pins are not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be removed.

action.action_description: Remove any virtual pins in the Assignment Editor.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Specifying Max Fanouts is not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development
optimization_record.description: Specifying Max Fanouts is not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and all max fanout assignments must be removed.

action.action_description: Remove any max fanout assignments in the Assignment Editor. If you have them in the source files, remove them as well.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Compile <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion revision
optimization_record.description: Compile the design and verify it fits in the selected <TOKEN_TEXT2> device.

action.action_description: Press the button below to start compilation.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Check <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion revision
optimization_record.description: Verify timing requirements were successfully met and all paths were timing constrained, Design Assistant passes with no errors and the specified companion <TOKEN_TEXT2> device is compatible with the design.

action.action_description: Press the button below to verify the compilation was successful for <TOKEN_TEXT2> development.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Compare companion revisions
optimization_record.description: For a project to be considered for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> conversion it must have both a <TOKEN_STRATIX> and <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> revision. These revisions are linked together and are called "Companion Revisions". The revisions must be synchronized and must not have any issues that would cause a problem for the <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> conversion. To ensure that the companion revisions are compatible you must run a command to compare the revisions.

action.action_description: Run the Compare <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> Companion Revisions command (Project menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Generate Handoff Report
optimization_record.description: Once your design is done and both companion revisions compare, you should generate a handoff report for a final review.

action.action_description: Run the Generate <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> Handoff Report command (Project menu).

optimization_record.recommendation: Archive Handoff Files and Send to Altera
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Archive Handoff Files and Send to Altera
optimization_record.description: Once your design is done and both companion revisions compare, you should archive your handoff files and send the archive file to Altera for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> design conversion consideration.

action.action_description: Run the Archive <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> Handoff Files command (Project menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable Misc. Timing Assignments
optimization_record.description: To achieve a smooth conversion of the Quartus II timing analysis assignments to the ones used by the HardCopy Design Center, turning on the following assignments: Cut off feedback from I/O pins, Cut off read during write signal paths, Cut off clear and preset signal paths, Default hold multicycle.

action.action_description: Turn on Cut off feedback from I/O pins, Cut off read during write signal paths, Cut off clear and preset signal paths, Default hold multicycle assignments in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable Misc. Timing Assignments
optimization_record.description: To achieve a smooth conversion of the Quartus II timing analysis assignments to the ones used by the HardCopy Design Center, turning on the following assignments: Cut off feedback from I/O pins, Cut off read during write signal paths, Cut off clear and preset signal paths, Default hold multicycle.

action.action_description: Turn on Cut off feedback from I/O pins, Cut off read during write signal paths, Cut off clear and preset signal paths, Default hold multicycle assignments in the More Timing Settings dialog box, available from the Timing Requirements & Options page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Remove Unsupported Global Timing Assignments
optimization_record.description: The following global timing assignments are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be removed: tsu Requirement, tco Requirement, tpd Requirement, th Requirement, Minimum tco Requirement, Minimum tpd Requirement.

action.action_description: Remove the tsu Requirement, tco Requirement, tpd Requirement, th Requirement, Minimum tco Requirement, Minimum tpd Requirement global timing assignments in the Timing Requirements & Options page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Remove Unsupported Global Timing Assignments
optimization_record.description: TSU_REQUIREMENT, TCO_REQUIREMENT, TPD_REQUIREMENT, TH_REQUIREMENT, MIN_TCO_REQUIREMENT, and MINIMUM_TPD_REQUIREMENT Timing Assignments are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be removed.

action.action_description: Remove the TSU_REQUIREMENT, TCO_REQUIREMENT, TPD_REQUIREMENT, TH_REQUIREMENT, MIN_TCO_REQUIREMENT, and MINIMUM_TPD_REQUIREMENT global timing assignments in the Timing Requirements & Options page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Remove Unsupported Instance Timing Assignments
optimization_record.description: The instance timing assignments listed in the table are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be removed. Please use the supported assignments as described in the <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> chapter of the Quartus II Handbook.

action.action_description: Remove the instance timing assignments listed in the table using the Assignment Editor (Assignments menu). Please use the supported assignments as described in the Quartus II Handbook.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Remove Unsupported Instance Timing Assignments
optimization_record.description: The instance timing assignments listed in the table are not supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be removed. Please use the supported assignments as described in the <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> chapter of the Quartus II Handbook.

action.action_description: Remove the instance timing assignments listed in the table using the Assignment Editor (Assignments menu). Please use the supported assignments as described in the Quartus II Handbook.

optimization_record.recommendation: Reserve all unused pins as inputs tri-stated with weak pull-ups
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Reserve all unused pins as inputs tri-stated with weak pull-ups
optimization_record.description: This setting reserves all unused pins on the target device as inputs tri-stated with weak pull-up. Altera recommends using this setting for unused pins to minimize any potential signal integrity differences between the <TOKEN_STRATIX> and <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> devices.

action.action_description: Set the "Reserve all unused pins" option to "As input tri-stated with weak pull-up" from the Unused Pins tab of the Device & Pin Options dialog box, available from the Device page of Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

acf_variable_list.acf_variable: AS INPUT TRI-STATED WITH WEAK PULL-UP
AS INPUT TRI-STATED WITH WEAK PULL-UP

optimization_record.recommendation: Reserve all unused pins as inputs tri-stated with weak pull-ups
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Reserve all unused pins as inputs tri-stated with weak pull-ups
optimization_record.description: This setting reserves all unused pins on the target device as inputs tri-stated with weak pull-up. Altera recommends using this setting for unused pins to minimize any potential signal integrity differences between the <TOKEN_STRATIX> and <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> devices.

action.action_description: Set the "Reserve all unused pins" option to "As input tri-stated with weak pull-up" from the Unused Pins tab of the Device & Pin Options dialog box, available from the Device page of Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

acf_variable_list.acf_variable: AS INPUT TRI-STATED WITH WEAK PULL-UP
AS INPUT TRI-STATED WITH WEAK PULL-UP

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Use the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer to check that all timing paths are constrained and meet timing.
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: Use the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer to check that the design is fully constrained. Use the button below to open the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer, and then, from the Tasks Pane, double-click the "Report Unconstrained Paths" to generate an unconstrained path report. Use this report to ensure that the design is fully constrained.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Use the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer to check that all timing paths are constrained and meet timing.
optimization_record.description: NA

action.action_description: Use the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer to check that the design is fully constrained. Use the button below to open the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer, and then, from the Tasks Pane, double-click the "Report Unconstrained Paths" to generate an unconstrained path report. Use this report to ensure that the design is fully constrained.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Check <TOKEN_TEXT1> revision
optimization_record.description: Verify the specified companion <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> device is compatible with the design, Design Assistant passes with no errors, the timing requirements were successfully met and all paths were timing constrained, and I/O types are fully defined for all the I/O pins.

action.action_description: Press the button below to verify the compilation was successful for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Check <TOKEN_TEXT2> companion revision
optimization_record.description: Verify timing requirements were successfully met and all paths were timing constrained, Design Assistant passes with no errors and the specified companion <TOKEN_TEXT2> device is compatible with the design.

action.action_description: Press the button below to verify the compilation was successful for <TOKEN_TEXT2> development.

optimization_record.recommendation: Enable optimizations of the hold time along all paths in the Fitter.
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable optimizations of the hold time along all paths in the Fitter.
optimization_record.description: You must enable optimizations of the hold time along all paths in the Fitter, to allow the Fitter to optimize hold time by adding delay to the appropriate paths, including internal core transfers. You must enable the Optimize Timing option to successfully enable optimizations of the hold time.

action.action_description: Turn on Optimize hold timing in the Fitter Settings page of the Settings dialog box. Then click the Optimize hold timing arrow and select All Paths.

optimization_record.recommendation: Enable optimizations of the hold time along all paths in the Fitter.
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable optimizations of the hold time along all paths in the Fitter.
optimization_record.description: You must enable optimizations of the hold time along all paths in the Fitter, to allow the Fitter to optimize hold time by adding delay to the appropriate paths, including internal core transfers. You must enable the Optimize Timing option to successfully enable optimizations of the hold time.

action.action_description: Turn on Optimize hold timing in the Fitter Settings page of the Settings dialog box. Then click the Optimize hold timing arrow and select All Paths.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Disable EDA Formal Verification Tool
optimization_record.description: Formal Verification is not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be turned off.

action.action_description: Turn off Formal Verification in the EDA Tools Settings page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Disable EDA Formal Verification Tool
optimization_record.description: Formal Verification is not currently supported for <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> development and must be turned off.

action.action_description: Turn off Formal Verification in the EDA Tools Settings page in the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation: Confirm JTAG user code and "delay entry to user mode" settings
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Confirm that the JTAG user code and "delay entry to user mode" settings in the Device & Pin Options Dialog box match user expectations
optimization_record.description: Altera HardCopy Design Center uses this information to determine how long to wait after power up to enter user mode and JTAG user code to be applied to this design. These settings cannot be changed after devices have been taped out.

action.action_description: Review the current settings to confirm they are correct.

optimization_record.recommendation: Confirm JTAG user code and "delay entry to user mode" settings
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Confirm that the JTAG user code and "delay entry to user mode" settings in the Device & Pin Options Dialog box match user expectations
optimization_record.description: Altera HardCopy Design Center uses this information to determine how long to wait after power up to enter user mode and JTAG user code to be applied to this design. These settings cannot be changed after devices have been taped out.

action.action_description: Review the current settings to confirm they are correct.

optimization_record.recommendation: Enable optimizations of fast-corner timing in the Fitter.
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable optimizations of fast-corner timing in the Fitter.
optimization_record.description: The setting tells the fitter to optimize the design to meet timing at the Fast Timing process corner and operating condition, as well as at the Slow Timing process corner and operating condition. Turning this option ON helps create a design implementation that is more robust across process, temperature, and voltage variations.

action.action_description: Turn on Optimize fast-corner timing in the Fitter Settings page of the Settings dialog box.

optimization_record.recommendation: Enable optimizations of fast-corner timing in the Fitter.
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable optimizations of fast-corner timing in the Fitter.
optimization_record.description: The setting tells the fitter to optimize the design to meet timing at the Fast Timing process corner and operating condition, as well as at the Slow Timing process corner and operating condition. Turning this option ON helps create a design implementation that is more robust across process, temperature, and voltage variations.

action.action_description: Turn on Optimize fast-corner timing in the Fitter Settings page of the Settings dialog box.

optimization_record.recommendation: Enable Multicorner Analysis in the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer.
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable Multicorner Analysis in the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer.
optimization_record.description: Directs the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer to perform multicorner timing analysis, which analyzes the design against best-case and worst-case operating conditions. Turning this option ON helps to verify that the design implementation is more robust across process, temperature, and voltage variations.

action.action_description: Turn on enable multicorner timing analysis in the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer page of the Settings dialog box.

optimization_record.recommendation: Enable Multicorner Analysis in the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer.
optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable Multicorner Analysis in the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer.
optimization_record.description: Directs the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer to perform multicorner timing analysis, which analyzes the design against best-case and worst-case operating conditions. Turning this option ON helps to verify that the design implementation is more robust across process, temperature, and voltage variations.

action.action_description: Turn on enable multicorner timing analysis in the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer page of the Settings dialog box.

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable HardCopy Design Readiness Check
optimization_record.description: Altera requires all HardCopy Series designs to be checked for I/O assignments using the HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow. Altera recommends turning on the HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow to run automatically during each compile, so that during development, you can view any I/Os which are missing I/O assignments and the default value are used for them. HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow is required to be run for all HardCopy designs and all I/Os without I/O assignments must be fixed before submitting your design to the Altera HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on the HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow in the More Compilation Process Settings dialog box of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Enable HardCopy Design Readiness Check
optimization_record.description: Altera requires all HardCopy Series designs to be checked for I/O assignments using the HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow. Altera recommends turning on the HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow to run automatically during each compile, so that during development, you can view any I/Os which are missing I/O assignments and the default value are used for them. HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow is required to be run for all HardCopy designs and all I/Os without I/O assignments must be fixed before submitting your design to the Altera HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on the HardCopy Design Readiness Check flow in the More Compilation Process Settings dialog box of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Turn on the Assembler
optimization_record.description: Altera recommends turning on the Assembler to run automatically during each compile, so that during your development, you can see violations that must be fixed. All HardCopy designs must be prototyped in an FPGA before being submitted for conversion.

action.action_description: Turn on the Assembler in the Compilation Process page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Turn on the Assembler
optimization_record.description: Altera recommends turning on the Assembler to run automatically during each compile, so that during your development, you can see violations that must be fixed. The files that are necessary for design handoff will not be generated without running the Assembler.

action.action_description: Turn on the Assembler in the Compilation Process page of the Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).

optimization_record.recommendation_description: Altera requires that you use the TimeQuest Timing Analyzer for migrating designs targeting <TOKEN_HARDCOPY> devices.
optimization_record.description: The TimeQuest Timing Analyzer's increased power and flexibility enables you to constrain more complex designs, especially those with complex clock schemes including clock muxing or source synchronous clock schemes. TimeQuest uses the same timing paradigm and Synopsys Design Constraint syntax as Synopsys PrimeTime, allowing a smooth migration to final layout in the Altera HardCopy Design Center.

action.action_description: Turn on Use TimeQuest Timing Analyzer during compilation in the Timing Analysis Settings dialog box (Assignments menu).
